Cowbird & Diamante Revealed!
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Cowbird & Diamante Revealed!
By Lisa Shock on Friday, June 13, 2003 - 12:13 pm:

I finally got Tecmo to tell me (after months of begging) what discs make Cowbird & Diamante. Here is what Brian said:

Cowbird: Back to the Future 3 Soundtrack

Diamante: (2 CDs) Diamond Life by Sade
Los Tres Diamantes (no CD specified, amazon.com has 35 listings)

Remember that if you buy these, there may still be various pressings and versions, some of which don't make the monster. So, don't blame me if it doesn't work.

By Nate Railsback on Saturday, June 14, 2003 - 03:30 am:

Holy crap, who on earth would have bought the Back to the Future 3 Soundtrack? I swear, they intentionally find the most obscure titles for some of these.

BTW, Lisa, has any research been done on just how many Mocchis there are in the game? I remember you saying awhile back that there were around 20 of them in the Japanese version. Since I have a PS2 Gameshark now, I'd be willing to check if no one else has. I'm not a hacker, though, and I've had a hard time picking up on patterns in PS2 GS codes, though, so I may need some help.

By John Hawley on Saturday, June 14, 2003 - 04:13 am:

>>Diamante: (2 CDs) Diamond Life by Sade

I KNEW it! I've been hunting a copy of this for like six weeks, ever since I found out that she had an album named that. Obviously someone is a Sade fan at Tecmo since this is the second time an album of hers has been used. Good Luck on this one as all I can find is the stupid cassette.

>>Cowbird: Back to the Future 3 Soundtrack

Wow! That explains my obsession with Clint Eastwood DVDs once I'd seen a picture of Cowbird. For those that don't know the story, Marty McFly, the hero of the Back To The Future films, is stuck in the 1950's and must travel even further back in time to the 1870's to save his mentor and the inventor of the time-travelling Deloreon. Since his family is already living in the area he is going to, the '50's version of his friend and mentor decides he should use a cover name and chooses that of a rising young cowboy star, Clint Eastwood.

Ah, well. Off to the used record stores. ; )
